channel.title: Trucks mpg
channel.description:
Got a trip coming up where I need to drive across country (U.S)
-I will be keeping the truck. -I need some space for my stuff. -$5,000 right now for it. -3 Seats
So what trucks seem to give the best mpg and size/space.
Best find so far is : 02 Jeep Grand Cherokee - $3009 Gas mileage is shit but it might work. Any other suggestions?

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

My 2000 gmc sierra (just 4.8L v8) get’s better gas economy than most v6 suv’s/vans… Don’t have the exact numbers, but I always get well over 700-800km’s from a 100L tank of gas.

What I really want is a new ford truck, with the v6 twin turbo. 32MPG

Read full topic

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I’m not jumping to conclusion I’m jumping to fact, if you want a RELIABLE SAFE vehicle the explorer is not your best bet especially if you have any common inclement weather. It’s always funny to see how many explorers are in accidents because they flipped our lost control during winter season.

Read full topic

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

mormonman:

How do you plan on selling your car? I’m trying to sell mine too, looking for tips on making it easier.

Just a tune up (oil change, etc etc) and clean the hell out of the inside. For the carpets I use a bucket of water, carpet cleaner/degreaser, brush and a shock vacuum. It makes the inside brand new and just the best job I can do at detailing it.

I am thinking about just taking both vehicles :s double the gas + insurance though.

mwiebelhaus:

HAHA, have fun with a Ford Explorer, HORRIBLE center of gravity, HORRIBLE gas milegage, not to mention the reliability of ford is shit, if you checked it out and loved it then apparently you have never drive a good vehicle before

I drove a lifted suburban for a few years, it was like driving a boat, the gas mileage was about $50 every 3-4 days. There are worse cars out there! The ford explorer, I thought of it being a ford, possible problems it could have, same concerns, I craigslist the vehicle finding the cheapest one in my area was $5800 with 180k miles on it. Considering I will be getting this vehicle for $4000 or $4500 at most, it’s a pretty decent steal, especially with the condition it is in. It ran smoothly, no problem with gravity.

The gas mileage is why I created this topic, it’s not the best (was hoping for something 25+) but considering this one is 20, it will do just fine.

I have drove many vehicles, some bad and some great, don’t jump to conclusion.

Read full topic

Edit: A friend of mine gave me the offer of a 2002 Ford Explorer, 2wd, 2door, 90k miles, $4500. I checked it out and love it. I have till June to make decide.[/quote]

HAHA, have fun with a Ford Explorer, HORRIBLE center of gravity, HORRIBLE gas milegage, not to mention the reliability of ford is shit, if you checked it out and loved it then apparently you have never drive a good vehicle before

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:12, topic:431112”]I forgot about the uhaul option and the pricing is pretty cheap (especially since its one way)

So anybody have any recommendations for suvs? Probably would go this route instead so I can fit more people.[/quote]

The SUV equivalent of the Dodge Dakota, the Dodge Durango. Same advantages, same engines, same reliable function. Or you can get a Jeep Grand Cherokee, those are equally nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @mormonman mormonman
item.description:
@mormonman wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:12, topic:431112”]I forgot about the uhaul option and the pricing is pretty cheap (especially since its one way)

So anybody have any recommendations for suvs? Probably would go this route instead so I can fit more people.[/quote]

Toyota 4Runners are fun. Not too expensive for 1998-2003. If you look around you should find one for your price range. Some models have the same engine as the tacoma.

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @mormonman mormonman
item.description:
@mormonman wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:431112”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=533788.msg3903195#msg3903195 date=1327960770]
@Mitb
fffurk… found some good deals and interested int the truck. I like it… but I realized another variable. I need three seats
[/quote]

You can get one with a bench seat (fits 3 people, not very comfortably though…), or you can get one with an extended cab that has a back seat, they even make them with 4 doors.

My 2001 Ford Ranger gets 22 mpg max on highway(usually on flatter roads) and its got the v8.

What is ‘The V8’ considering Ford has never made a Ranger with a V8 in it? I’m assuming you mean V6.

Dodge is the only company to put a V8 in a smaller truck, and if you get the smaller one (5.2L 318ci) it gets pretty good gas mileage. My guess is the 2wd version would get at least 20.[/quote]

Yes that is what I meant. Post time: 12 am, I was kinda out of it.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:5, topic:431112”]@Mitb
fffurk… found some good deals and interested int the truck. I like it… but I realized another variable. I need three seats :D[/quote]

You can get one with a bench seat (fits 3 people, not very comfortably though…), or you can get one with an extended cab that has a back seat, they even make them with 4 doors.

mormonman:

My 2001 Ford Ranger gets 22 mpg max on highway(usually on flatter roads) and its got the v8.

What is ‘The V8’ considering Ford has never made a Ranger with a V8 in it? I’m assuming you mean V6.

Dodge is the only company to put a V8 in a smaller truck, and if you get the smaller one (5.2L 318ci) it gets pretty good gas mileage. My guess is the 2wd version would get at least 20.

Read full topic

item.title: Trucks mpg
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sometimes trucks don’t get very bad gas mileage on the highway, it’s mainly around town where big tires hurt you, they help on the highway. But you need to watch out for low gears and such.

That price for a 02 Jeep Grand Cherokee sounds pretty good to me, and it’s a mopar.

Otherwise, look into a Dodge Dakota with a 318 in it, those get good gas mileage and the motor is practically bullet proof.

Read full topic
